segment.source: Fine-Tune a Custom Power Plan
segment.target: Fine-Tune a Custom Power Plan

segment.source: Fine-Tune a Custom Power Plan
segment.target: Fine-Tune a Custom Power Plan

segment.source: Fine-Tune a Custom Power Plan
segment.target: Fine-Tune a Custom Power Plan

segment.source: A power plan is a collection of hardware and system settings that manages how computers use and conserve power.
segment.target: A power plan is a collection of hardware and system settings that manages how computers use and conserve power.

segment.source: You can create custom power plans that are optimized for specific computers.
segment.target: You can create custom power plans that are optimized for specific computers.

segment.source: You can manage most common power plan settings through Control Panel.
segment.target: You can manage most common power plan settings through Control Panel.

segment.source: For more information, see Create a Custom Power Plan.
segment.target: For more information, see Create a Custom Power Plan.

segment.source: To fine-tune hardware-specific configurations that are not configurable through Control Panel, use the PowerCfg tool.
segment.target: To fine-tune hardware-specific configurations that are not configurable through Control Panel, use the PowerCfg tool.

segment.source: Manually Modifying a Power Plan
segment.target: Manually Modifying a Power Plan

segment.source: You can customize all configurable Windows power options by using the command from an elevated command prompt.
segment.target: You can customize all configurable Windows power options by using the command from an elevated command prompt.

segment.source: This includes hardware-specific configurations that are not configurable through Control Panel.
segment.target: This includes hardware-specific configurations that are not configurable through Control Panel.

segment.source: To list the available power plans
segment.target: To list the available power plans

segment.source: On your technician computer, at an elevated command prompt, type the following:
segment.target: On your technician computer, at an elevated command prompt, type the following:

segment.source: The computer will return the list of available power plans.
segment.target: The computer will return the list of available power plans.

segment.source: In the following examples, these plans are Balanced and Power saver.
segment.target: In the following examples, these plans are Balanced and Power saver.

segment.source: Note the GUIDs that are listed next to the power plans that you want to change.
segment.target: Note the GUIDs that are listed next to the power plans that you want to change.

segment.source: You will need these GUIDs to manually update settings and capture the power plans.
segment.target: You will need these GUIDs to manually update settings and capture the power plans.

segment.source: To set the power plan to be modified as active
segment.target: To set the power plan to be modified as active

segment.source: To modify a plan, use the GUID of the power plan that you want to change to set that power plan as the active power plan.
segment.target: To modify a plan, use the GUID of the power plan that you want to change to set that power plan as the active power plan.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: To adjust the settings
segment.target: To adjust the settings

segment.source: This section describes how to manually configure other power configuration settings by using the command.
segment.target: This section describes how to manually configure other power configuration settings by using the command.

segment.source: Test these settings to create an optimal power plan for your system.
segment.target: Test these settings to create an optimal power plan for your system.

segment.source: Find information about the existing power setting.
segment.target: Find information about the existing power setting.

segment.source: At an elevated command prompt, type the following:
segment.target: At an elevated command prompt, type the following:

segment.source: The computer displays information for all of the power settings for this plan.
segment.target: The computer displays information for all of the power settings for this plan.

segment.source: Find the GUID for the subgroup of the setting that you want to change.
segment.target: Find the GUID for the subgroup of the setting that you want to change.

segment.source: For example, to modify a display setting, find the GUID for the Display subgroup:
segment.target: For example, to modify a display setting, find the GUID for the Display subgroup:

segment.source: Find the GUID for the setting that you want to change.
segment.target: Find the GUID for the setting that you want to change.

segment.source: For example, to modify the Display Brightness setting, find the GUID for the (Display brightness) setting:
segment.target: For example, to modify the Display Brightness setting, find the GUID for the (Display brightness) setting:

segment.source: Review the information from the query command, review the possible settings, and determine a value that works for your computer.
segment.target: Review the information from the query command, review the possible settings, and determine a value that works for your computer.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You must enter these values by using decimal integers.
segment.target: You must enter these values by using decimal integers.

segment.source: However, the values appear on the screen as hexadecimal values that are specific to the setting.
segment.target: However, the values appear on the screen as hexadecimal values that are specific to the setting.

segment.source: For example, to set the maximum display brightness to 50 percent brightness, enter the value as 50.
segment.target: For example, to set the maximum display brightness to 50 percent brightness, enter the value as 50.

segment.source: When you use the command to confirm the setting, the value appears as 0x00000032.
segment.target: When you use the command to confirm the setting, the value appears as 0x00000032.

segment.source: Adjust the value for the power setting for times when the computer is plugged in.
segment.target: Adjust the value for the power setting for times when the computer is plugged in.

segment.source: For example, to set the display brightness level to 100 percent when the computer is plugged in, type the following:
segment.target: For example, to set the display brightness level to 100 percent when the computer is plugged in, type the following:

segment.source: Adjust the value for the power setting for times when the computer is on battery power.
segment.target: Adjust the value for the power setting for times when the computer is on battery power.

segment.source: For example, to set the display brightness level to 75 percent when the computer is on battery power, type the following:
segment.target: For example, to set the display brightness level to 75 percent when the computer is on battery power, type the following:

segment.source: Use the Query command to verify the setting.
segment.target: Use the Query command to verify the setting.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: The computer shows the new power setting index in hexadecimal notation.
segment.target: The computer shows the new power setting index in hexadecimal notation.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: The hexadecimal value 0x00000064 represents 100 percent display brightness when the computer is plugged in.
segment.target: The hexadecimal value 0x00000064 represents 100 percent display brightness when the computer is plugged in.

segment.source: The hexadecimal value 0x0000004b represents 75 percent display brightness when the computer is using battery power.
segment.target: The hexadecimal value 0x0000004b represents 75 percent display brightness when the computer is using battery power.
